Documentation

data Possible a Source

Constructors

Possible a

If the action if possible, with the result.

NotPossible String

If the action is impossible with a error message.

Instances

Eq a => Eq (Possible a) 
Show a => Show (Possible a)

possibleToListSource

Arguments

:: Possible [a]

A possible action.

-> [a]

The result of the action, [] if not possible.

possibleToList, convert 'Possible [a]' to '[a]'.

repartitionSource

Arguments

:: Int

Number to split.

-> Int

Size of a split wanted.

-> Int

Above margin tolerated.

-> Int

Below margin tolerated.

-> Bool

True, if the user prefers splits uniform, no matter if there is a huge variation with the size wanted. False if he wants the solution the closest.

-> Possible [Int]

Possible size repartition.

repartition, give a list of group size, for the best repartition.

repartition'Source

Arguments

:: Int

Number to split.

-> Int

Size of a split wanted.

-> Int

Above margin tolerated.

-> Int

Below margin tolerated.

-> Int

Variation.

-> (Bool, [Int])

If a repartition is possible then it returns (True, repartition) else (False, []).

repartition', tries to create a repartion with less variations possible.

repartitionUniformSource

Arguments

:: Int

Number to split.

-> Int

Size of a split wanted.

-> Int

Above margin tolerated.

-> Int

Below margin tolerated.

-> Int

Variation.

-> (Bool, [Int])

If a repartition is possible then it returns (True, repartition) else (False, []).

repartitionUniform, repartition with the same size for each split, and with the closest possible size of the size wanted.

repartition2MultipleSource

Arguments

:: Int

Number to split.

-> [(Int, Int, Int)]

List of splits with for each split : the size wanted, the above margin and the below margin.

-> Possible [[Int]]

Possible size repartition, list of list of splits.

repartition2Source

Arguments

:: Int

Number to split.

-> [(Int, Int, Int)]

List of splits with for each split : the size wanted, the above margin and the below margin. Each split is done once.

-> Possible [Int]

Possible size repartition.

sumTripletsSource

Arguments

:: Num a 
=> [(a, a, a)]

Triplets.

-> (a, a, a)

The sum.

sumTriplets, sum a list of triplet. sumTriplet [(1,2,4),(-1,0,5)] => (0,2,9).

sumList :: Num a => [a] -> [a] -> [a]Source

sumList, do the sum of 2 lists. Ex : sumList [1,2] [2,3,4] => [3,5,4]

repartition2'Source

Arguments

:: Int

.

-> Int

.

-> [(Int, Int, Int)]

.

-> [Int]

.

repartition2', cf repartition2, expect that repartition2' is used only when there is a solution and the second parameter take the difference between the number to split and the sum of sizes wanted
